Results.Title: Learn To Win: Cost
Results.Summary: Ahead of Formula Student 2015, UK judges give their advice on how to win with any budget.

Results.Title: Learn To Win: Design
Results.Summary: Ahead of Formula Student 2015, UK judges give their advice to competitors and explain how to get the most our of their vehicle designs.

Results.Title: Learn To Win: Project Management
Results.Summary: Ahead of Formula Student 2015, UK judges give their advice on how to project manage a Formula Student entry.

Results.Title: Learn To Win: Static Events
Results.Summary: Ahead of Formula Student 2015, UK judges give their advice to competitors and explain how to score maximum points in the static events.

Results.Title: Learn To Win: Dynamic Events
Results.Summary: Ahead of Formula Student 2015, UK judges give their advice to competitors and explain how to avoid pitfalls they have seen in previous events.

Results.Title: Annual Dinner 2014
Results.Summary: The 2014 annual dinner event hosted by Group Captain Mark Hunt, President of the Institution.

Results.Title: How is a Brompton bicycle engineered?
Results.Summary: The Institution takes a tour of the factory that produces the the iconic Brompton fold-up bicycle.

Results.Title: Bloodhound SSC in Belfast
Results.Summary: A full-scale model of the 1,000mph Bloodhound super-sonic car swept into Stormont recently capturing the imaginations of more than 210 local school children.

Results.Title: The Institution of Mechanical Engineers' Annual Dinner 2014
Results.Summary: The Institution of Mechanical Engineers' Annual Dinner for 2014 once again returned to London's Dorchester Hotel, hosted by Group Captain Mark Hunt, President of the Institution.

Results.Title: Formula Student: Learn to Win
Results.Summary: The Learn to Win day event provides team members with the chance to attend panel discussions, presentations and drop-in sessions, where they can ask questions to the specialist engineers and head judges.

Results.Title: International Vehicle Aerodynamics Conference 2014
Results.Summary: Building on the successful International Vehicle Aerodynamics Conference series supported by the Royal Aeronautical Society and MIRA since 1994, the 2014 conference provided an opportunity for engineers, designers, academics and researchers to discuss a wide range of topics relating to vehicle aerodynamics.
Tags: Drag reduction through design and technology

Results.Title: Downstream Effects on F1 Vehicles
Results.Summary: Josh Newbon, from the School of Engineering and Computing Sciences at Durham University, explains the effects of the wake from a generic Formula 1 car on a downstream vehicle.

Results.Title: Real World Drag Coefficient
Results.Summary: Steve Windsor, from Jaguar Land Rover, asks if real world drag coefficient is wind averaged drag.

Results.Title: Coupled thermal and aerodynamic design
Results.Summary: Simon Huber from the Institute of Aerodynamics and Fluid Mechanics and Technical University Munich, explains the coupled thermal and aerodynamic design process within car production.

Results.Title: Shape Optimisation Using Adjoint Methods
Results.Summary: Mark Keating, Lead Engineer at ANSYS UK Ltd, talks about shape optimisation for aerodynamic performance using adjoint methods.

Results.Title: Forcing Boundary Layer Transition
Results.Summary: Luke Roberts, from the Aerodynamical Systems Group at Cranfield Univeristy, presents an investigation of forcing boundary layer transition on a single-element inverted wing in ground effect.

Results.Title: The Influence of Vehicle Ride Height and Wheel Position
Results.Summary: Alexey Vdovin, from the department of Applied Mechanics at Chalmers University of Technology, explains how vehicle ride height and wheel position influence the aerodynamic forces of ground vehicles.

Results.Title: Trapped Vortices and Ground Vehicles
Results.Summary: Abdessalem Bouferrouk, from the Department of Engineering Design and Mathematics at the University of West England, discusses the applicability of trapped vortices to ground vehicles.

Results.Title: Aerodynamic Effects During Manoeuvres
Results.Summary: Andreas Kremheller, Aerodynamics Engineer at Nissan Technical Centre, discusses the aerodynamic effects during overtaking and passing manoeuvres.

Results.Title: Classification of Aerodynamic Tyre Characteristics
Results.Summary: Felix Wittmeier, from IVK/FKFS at Universität Stuttgart, explains the classification of aerodynamic tyre characteristics.

Results.Title: High Turbulence Conditions
Results.Summary: Joao Carreia, from the Aerodynamical Systems Group at Cranfield University, gives a talk on aerodynamic characteristics of a Monoposto racing car front wing operating in high turbulence conditions.

Results.Title: Wake Structure and Base Pressure
Results.Summary: David Forbes, from the Aeronautical and Automotive Engineering Department at Loughborough University, presents a computational study of wake structure and base pressure on a generic SUV model.

Results.Title: Aerodynamic Drag in a Windy Environment
Results.Summary: Jeff Howell, Technical Specialist in Aerodynamics at Tata Motors European Technical Centre, gives a talk on aerodynamic drag in a windy environment.

Results.Title: Traversing Unit Effect on Flow Structures
Results.Summary: Lennert Sterken, from the Department of Applied Mechanics at Chalmers University of Technology, explains the effect of a traversing unit on the flow structure behind a passenger vehicle.

Results.Title: Three-Dimensional Flow Separation Patterns and Surface Pressure Gradients on a Vehicle
Results.Summary: Sabine Bonitz, from Chalmers University of Technology, presents an investigation of 3D flow separation patterns and surface pressure gradients on a notchback vehicle.

Results.Title: Predictive Capability of Advance RANS Models
Results.Summary: Neil Ashton from the School of Mechanical Aerospace and Civil Engineering at Manchester University, presents an investigation into the predictive capability of advance RANS models for the Driver Automotive Model.

Results.Title: The 100th Engineering Heritage Award
Results.Summary: The Old Furnace at Coalbrookdale in Shropshire is awarded the 100th Engineering Heritage Award.

Results.Title: The Old Furnace, Coalbrookdale Shropshire
Results.Summary: Dr Matt Thompson, Senior Curator at the Ironbridge Gorge Museum Trust, gives a brief overview of the history of the site and the furnace.

Results.Title: The Design Challenge 2014
Results.Summary: Students compete in the Design Challenge 2014.

Results.Title: 2014 Vision Award Winners
Results.Summary: The Vision Awards celebrates those who, in their work, training or learning, have demonstrated an exceptional commitment to engineering and its future.

Results.Title: 2014 Prestige Award Winners
Results.Summary: 2014 Prestige Award winners discuss their awards and the future of the industry.

Results.Title: Gaseous Fuels for Road Vehicles
Results.Summary: Speakers from a variety of European organisations discussed how they plan to, or are already using, gaseous fuels as an alternative to traditional petroleum.

Results.Title: Methane as a vehicle fuel
Results.Summary: Matthias Maedge, Deputy Secretary General, NGVA Europe, gives a keynote lecture on methane as a vehicle fuel in Europe.

Results.Title: Building Information Modelling (BIM) for Manufacturing
Results.Summary: This lecture, jointly hosted, with Autodesk, was a unique opportunity to hear from contractors and manufacturers who have successfully implemented BIM within their companies.

Results.Title: How Tata Steel is Implementing BIM
Results.Summary: Steve Thompson, Head of BIM at Tata Steel, speaks about implementing BIM at the organisation.

Results.Title: UK BIM Level 2
Results.Summary: John Enyo from Open Water Consulting, speaks about UK BIM level 2

Results.Title: Tidal Energy Lecture
Results.Summary: The UK is currently the undisputed global leader in Marine Energy with more wave and tidal stream devices installed than the rest of the world combined.
Tags: UK government Policy and future support for wave and tidal energy

Results.Title: Tidal Energy
Results.Summary: Dr George A Aggidis, Director of Lancaster University Renewable Energy Group & Fluid Machinery Group, discusses recent reports showing that tidal energy could become the major supplier of UK energy.

Results.Title: How Automation and Robotics will Change how Factories Operate
Results.Summary: Dr Emma Rushforth, Senior Teaching Fellow at Warwick Manufacturing Group, discusses the latest research on automation and robotics.

Results.Title: Formula Student 2014: Competitors arrive
Results.Summary: Competitors arrive at the 2014 Formula Student event held at Silverstone.

Results.Summary: Teams prepare their vehicles for scrutineering

Results.Summary: Advice from Mercedes AMG Petronas' Paddy Lowe

Results.Summary: The sprint event gives teams a chance to showcase what their vehicles can do

Results.Title: Formula Student 2014: Team picture
Results.Summary: This year's Formula Student competitors join together in a team picture on the race track at Silverstone

Results.Title: Advice from Caterham Group's Mike Gascoyne
Results.Summary: Mike Gascoyne, longstanding designer of Formula One cars and the Chief Technical Officer of the Caterham Group, gives his advice to graduates looking to make it in F1.

Results.Title: What does Formula Student mean to you?
Results.Summary: Highlights from the 2014 Formula Student event held over five days at Silverstone.

Results.Summary: Students compete in the acceleration dynamic event as part of Formula Student 2014

Results.Summary: Teams talk about their performance during the skid pad dynamic event

Results.Summary: Formula Student is the testing ground for the next generation of world-class engineers.

Results.Title: 2014 Presidential Inauguration Speech
Results.Summary: The 129th President of the Institution of Mechanical Engineers, Group Captain Mark Hunt, gives his inauguration speech.

Results.Title: The 2014 Railway Challenge
Results.Summary: Now in its third year, the Railway Challenge, showcases up and coming talent in the industry as teams compete to design and manufacture a small-scale locomotive.

Results.Title: Advanced EOR 2014
Results.Summary: Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR) techniques have grown making deep sea recovery easier, cheaper and more attractive to those seeking to exploit the opportunities within the North Sea. This conference explores...

Results.Title: Supporting UK EOR projects
Results.Summary: David Rutland, Office of Carbon Capture and Storage, DECC, discusses the UK Government CCS Programme, the role of OCCS in UK EOR projects and identifies the potential of marrying CCS and future EOR technology.

Results.Title: EOR Development in the UK
Results.Summary: Jonathan Thomas, Senior Reservoir Engineer, Energy Development Unit, DECC, speaks about EOR Development in the UK.

Results.Title: Health and Safety Executive’s Offshore Directive
Results.Summary: Jim Neilson, Head Offshore, Pipelines and Diving Policy, HSE, speaks about, health and saftey executives offshore directive.

Results.Title: Chemical EOR and the Need for Integration
Results.Summary: Eric Delamaide speaks about chemical EOR at Advanced EOR 2014.

Results.Title: Low Salinity:  Work in Progress
Results.Summary: Keith Mackie, Operations Director, ITF, speaks about Low Salinity:  Work in Progress

Results.Title: Weynurn-Midale Oilfields in Southern Saskatchewan
Results.Summary: Kyle Worth, Aquistore Project Manager, PTRC, speaks about a decade of world-leading research associated with Weynurn-Midale oilfields in Southern Saskatchewan.

Results.Title: Smarter Factories
Results.Summary: How new technologies can improve the performance and competitiveness of UK manufacturing

Results.Title: Recent Developments in Advanced Materials
Results.Summary: Dr Helen Meese, Head of Engineering in Society at IMechE, talks about how advanced materials will strengthen the UK’s future.

Results.Title: Why The Government Needs to Boost the Prospects of UK Manufacturing
Results.Summary: Terry Scuoler, Chief Executive of manufacturers’ organisation, the EEF, talks about government responsibility within manufacturing.

Results.Title: Sheffield’s factory of the future: The AMRC
Results.Summary: Ben Morgan, Head of Integrated Manufacturing at Sheffield AMRC, explains how the research centre operates and the thinking behind creating a ‘factory for the future’.

Results.Summary: Students explain how they landed jobs and apprentiships at top companies including Bentley Motors and Mercedes

Results.Title: 2014 Presidential Inauguration Interview
Results.Summary: The inauguration interview of the 129th President, Group Captain Mark Hunt.

Results.Title: Engineering Heritage Awards
Results.Summary: From hovercraft to sewage works, from railway lines to bombers, mechanical engineering plays a vital role. The Engineering Heritage Awards celebrate and promote this by recognising artefacts, locations, collections and landmarks of significant mechanical engineering importance. Established in 1984 by the Institution of Mechanical Engineers, they increase public awareness of engineering, past and present.
